description.p: Reaching into a small bag around her neck held by a golden-linked chain, an elf removes a pinch of fine, sparkling powder, murmurs beneath her breath and blows the dust across her hand. Her assailant’s eyes roll into the back of his head as he slumps to the floor, snoring.

A wirey gnome rolls away from a poorly aimed crossbow bolt, springing to his feet. Though battle roars about them, his whispers are heard by the soldier. Moments later, the he throws his hands up to ward off an unseen horror, drops his weapon and screams.
Looking about the desert disapprovingly, a tan skinned tiefling closes his eyes and concetrates. Upon opening them, the landscape is transformed into a mist-shrouded forest. Dream made reality.

While some draw magic from pure knowledge and training, Dreamers use the abstract, intuitive part of their mind to connect and drawpower from the Dream Plane. Using mere thought, Dreamers can step into and use the parallel dream plane to manifest change in the material world and its denizens.

Harnessing and manipulating the magics of the dream-like Feywild is a difficult task, as few are able to understand, let alone control, the indefinite Feywild. Dreamers can weave, unravel and even replace the innermost secrets and desires of those nearby. Being inexorably linked to a dream plane that defies the natural laws of the material world takes great strength of mind. With this power, Dreamers can force sleep upon the restless, travel swiftly, and even breathe life into one’s very dreams and nightmares.

The magic of the Feywild can be harnessed and used to access dreams and change reality. Dreamers can physically enter the dreamscape of the Feywild to manipulate the material world, access dreams and thoughts, travel great distances in a short time or augment one’s magical abilities or battle prowess. Experienced dreamers can be devious combatants, striking out mentally and physically from both the material and dreamworld planes.

The first thing you should decide when creating a Dreamer is what decision or event occurred providing your character with access or a connection to the Feywild, specifically its dream-like realms. As a starting character you will need to choose whether you will serve the Seelie (Summer Court), the Unseelie (Winter Court) or even the Dark Powers of the Shadowfell! Your decision will determine how your powers manifest as you gain levels in this class. Will you choose a path under the protective, nature-abiding, power-hungry Summer Fey? The cold, calculating Winter Fey who promote survival by sheer will? Or would you harness the evil, negative energies of the Shadowfell, in exchange for your eternal life? Much of a Dreamer’s power manifests as magical manipulation of another’s mind or the physical space around you.

As a Dreamer you will also want to know what you want to do with this power. Are you looking to augment your magical studies or abilities? Do you intend to join the ranks of a Fey or Toril army? Do you seek a way to connect with mystical creatures like centaurs or dryads? Have you been tricked or persuaded into the Feywild by an Oni or hag? Do you seek out or have you been trapped by the domains of Strahd von Zarovich or the Raven Queen? Your DM can help you determine what role you serve within a Court or whether your connection even requires service. Some dreamers choose a path of protection or support. Others choose a more violent path through magic or weapon mastery. No matter what path or choices you make for your Dreamer, it will be the creative application of dreams and nightmares that separate Dreamers with their heads in the clouds from those firmly grounded in the workings of the subconscious mind.

You can make a dreamer quickly by following these suggestions. First, Intelligence should be your highest ability score, followed by Constitution. Second, choose the Sage background. Third, choose the message and ray of frost cantrips, along with the 1st-level spells faerie fire and magic missile.
As a dreamer, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Dice: 1d8 per class level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per class level after 1st
Armor: Light armor
Weapons: Simple weapons
Tools: Herbalism Kit
Saving Throws: Constitution, Intelligence
Skills: Choose two skills from Arcana, Deception, Investigation, Insight, Persuasion, and Religion.

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a quarterstaff or (b) any simple weapon
(a) a component pouch or (b) a dream focus
(a) a scholar’s pack or (b) an explorer’s pack
Leather armor, a dagger, and an herbalism kit

tr.td: Dream Casting, Dream Walker, Faerie Bond

setters.set: A spellcaster that harnesses the power of the Dreamworld.

sheet.description: description

description.p: At 1st level, your dreamwalking brings you in proximity to the Feywild. Choose a Court of the Faeries you will enter into service to: Seelie, Unseelie, or the Shadowfell. They will shape the course of your dream powers. Each Court is detailed at the end of the class description. Your choice grants you an Avatar at 3rd level and additional features at 1st, 3rd, 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

Your deep experience with dreams allows you to connect subconsciously to the dream plane of the Feywild. Its dreamlike realms allow you to move about and manipulate the material world around you. See chapter 10 for the general rules of spellcasting and the end of the class description for the dreamer spell list.

At 1st level, you know two cantrips of your choice from the dreamer spell list. You learn additional dreamer cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Dreamer table.

The Dreamer table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these dreamer spells, you must expend a slot of the spell’s level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a short or long rest.
For example, when you are 5th level, you have two 3rd-level spell slots. To cast the 1st-level spell magic missle, you must spend one of those slots, and you cast it as a 3rd-level spell.
description.h5: SPELLS KNOWN OF 1ST LEVEL OR HIGHER
description.p: You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the dreamer spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Dreamer table shows when you learn more dreamer spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots, as shown on the table. For instance, when you reach 3rd level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the dreamer spells you know and replace it with another spell from the dreamer spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your dreamer spells. Your magic is derived from your link to the dream-like Feywild. You use your Intelligence whenever a dreamer spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a dreamer spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier
You can cast a dreamer spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.

Starting at 1st level, you can step into the dream plane, an overlap between the abstract Feywild and your current plane, as an action or bonus action. When a creature that you can see attacks you, you can use your reaction to dreamwalk as well. A fine mist obscures your form. You can use this feature twice. You regain expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.
While dream walking you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Etheral Form: You can move through the space of all creatures.
Lullaby: You can cast the sleep spell once per dreamwalk at the highest level for which you know a spell, without expending a spell slot.

Dream Movement: Choose one: Spiderclimb, Water Walk, Levitate (as the levitation spell). You can utilize this movement, at half your base walking speed (rounded down), until the dreamwalk ends and can not switch the movement type until beginning a new dreamwalk.

description.p: While you are dreamwalking, you are unable to speak directly with anyone in the material plane, unless by magical means. You can still be seen, targeted by attacks and spell attacks or affected by area of effect spells and abilities on the material plane.
Your dreamwalk lasts 1 minute. It ends early if you are knocked unconscious. You can also end your dream walk on your turn as a bonus action.

sheet.description: You can step into the dream plane for 1 minute as an action, bonus action or as a reaction when a creature that you can see attacks you. You gain the following benefits: you can move through any occupied space; you can cast sleep once, without expending a spell slot; you can spiderwalk, water walk or levitate at half your speed.

You can step into the dream plane for 1 minute as an action, bonus action or as a reaction when a creature that you can see attacks you. You gain the following benefits: you can move through any occupied space; you can cast sleep once, without expending a spell slot; you can spiderwalk, water walk, pass through water or levitate at your movement speed.

You can step into the dream plane for 1 minute as an action, bonus action or as a reaction when a creature that you can see attacks you. You gain the following benefits: you can move through any occupied space; you can cast sleep once, without expending a spell slot; you can spiderwalk, water walk, pass through water, levitate or fly at your movement speed. If you already have flight, you double your flying speed.

You can step into the dream plane indefinitely as an action, bonus action or as a reaction when a creature that you can see attacks you. You gain the following benefits: you can move through any occupied space; you can cast sleep once, without expending a spell slot; you can spiderwalk, water walk, pass through water, levitate or fly at your movement speed. If you already have flight, you double your flying speed.

description.p: At 2nd level, you have proven worthy to your chosen Court and have been bestowed the following blessings.

Dreamer’s Slumber. Dreamers only need to sleep for 4 hours a day. While slumbering, your dreams are vivid expresions of solace and freedom. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that others do from 8 hours of sleep.
You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put you to sleep.
While dreamwalking, your weapons deal psychic damage instead of their normal damage type.

sheet.description: You only need to sleep for 4 hours a day. You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put you to sleep. While dreamwalking, your weapons deal psychic damage instead of their normal damage type.

description.p: Beginning at 2nd level, Dreamers can augment the very nature of the sleep spell. Your control and mastery of this spell is unrivaled.
The dice rolled for the sleep spell becomes a d10. The die becomes a d12 at 11th level.
If you so choose, you may change the range of sleep to touch, allowing you to affect creatures in the order touched.

sheet.description: The dice rolled for the sleep spell is a d10. You may change the range of sleep to touch, allowing you to affect creatures in the order touched.
The dice rolled for the sleep spell is a d12. You may change the range of sleep to touch, allowing you to affect creatures in the order touched.

description.p: At 3rd level, you embody an Avatar as you dreamwalk, providing access to additional powers from the Feywild. Your chosen Court will determine the Avatar granted to you. Weaver, Warrior and Stalker are all detailed at the end of the class description.

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Alternatively, you can choose a feat (see Chapter 6 for a list of feats).
At 5th level your Dream Movement can be utilized at your full base walking speed. Also, you gain an additional movement option: Pass Through Water
Beginning at 7th level, you can add your Intelligence modifier to any damage roll or saving throw to avoid taking damage.

sheet.description: You add your Intelligence modifier ({{intelligence:modifier}}) to any damage roll or saving throw to avoid taking damage.

description.p: Upon reaching 9th level in this class, your experience in the dream world strengthens your bond and resolve.
While dreamwalking, you can read dreams or thoughts, as the detect thoughts spell. You may only use this ability once per dreakwalk. The spell ends if you take any other action or the dreamwalk ends.
Additionally, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your concentration on a spell when you take damage.

sheet.description: While dreamwalking, you can read dreams or thoughts, as the detect thoughts spell. You may only use this ability once per dreakwalk. The spell ends if you take any other action or the dreamwalk ends. Additionally, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your concentration on a spell when you take damage.

description.p: At 11th level, you transcend your chosen Fey court and learn to bind powerful spells to your dreams. Choose one 6th-level spell from the dreamer spell list as this spellbinding.
You can cast your bound spell once without expending a spell slot. You must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

At higher levels, you gain more dreamer spells of your choice that can be cast in this way: one 7th-level spell at 13th level, one 8th-level spell at 15th level, and one 9th-level spell at 17th level. You regain all uses of your Fey Spellbinding when you finish a long rest.
Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the fey spellbindings you know and replace it with another spellbinding that you could learn at that level.

sheet.description: You can cast your bound spell once without expending a spell slot.
You can cast each of your bound spells once without expending a spell slot.

description.p: At 15th level, you have become a master of the unconscious domain.

Fight: While unconscious, you may continue casting cantrips or spells you know that target only one creature other than yourself. If you cast a spell of 1st level or greater this way, you must have an available spell slot and doing so will cause you to suffer a death saving throw failure.
Flight: You gain an additional Dream Movement option: Flying. If you already have a base flying speed, it is doubled.

sheet.description: While unconscious, you may continue casting cantrips or spells you know that target only one creature other than yourself. If you cast a spell of 1st level or greater this way, you must have an available spell slot and doing so will cause you to suffer a death saving throw failure.

description.p: At 20th level, you can dreamwalk indefinitely.

Additionally, as an action, you can pull up to 8 allies into your dream. Each ally gains a Dream Movement of their choice equaling their base walking speed. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest

sheet.description: You can pull up to 8 allies into your dream. Each ally gains a Dream Movement of their choice equaling their base walking speed.

description.p: Those who serve the Seelie Court seek to unravel the natural mysteries of the unconscious mind and gain the Avatar of the Dream Weaver. Dedicated to the mystical and arcane nature of the Feywild, they learn to enhance and augment their own dreams while manipulating the dreams of others. Those who become dream weavers typically respect the tenents and laws of nature. Some are accused of having their heads in the clouds or preferring landscapes and items that are abstract or unique by nature. The shaping of dreams requires a flexible mind, which leads to incredible mystical powers.
The Seelie lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a dreamer spell. The following spells are added to the dreamer spell list for you.

When you take the avatar of the dream weaver at 3rd level, your mind is firmly linked with the pervasive dream plane allowing you to directly target creatures’ minds. Wisp-like strands of dream dust infuse your spells.

ul.li: If you are aware of a creature’s presence, you do not need to see the creature to target it with a spell that would normally require it. However, this does not reveal the location of a hidden or invisible creature. This feature has no effect on undead and constructs.
Your spells deal an extra 1d6 to sleeping targets.

sheet.description: Wisp-like strands of dream dust infuse your spells. If you are aware of a creature’s presence, you do not need to see the creature to target it with a spell that would normally require it. However, this does not reveal the location of a hidden or invisible creature. This feature has no effect on undead and constructs. Your spells deal an extra 1d6 to sleeping targets.

description.p: A 2 foot length of wood, glass, stone, or metal becomes a spellcasting focus for your dreamer spells. You are proficient with wands. Additionally, choose a damage type for your wand: Fire or Lightning. As an action, you can use this wand to make a spell attack against a creature. The range is 90 feet. On a hit, the creature takes damage equal to 1d8 + your Dreamer level. A second wand may be dual-wielded as the Two-Weapon Fighting option.

sheet.description: A 2 foot length of wood, glass, stone, or metal becomes a spellcasting focus for your dreamer spells. You are proficient with wands. Additionally, choose a damage type for your wand: Fire or Lightning. As an action, you can use this wand to make a spell attack against a creature. The range is 90 feet. On a hit, the creature takes damage equal to 1d8 + {{level:dreamer}}. A second wand may be dual-wielded as the Two-Weapon Fighting option.

description.p: At 6th level you learn to weave spells through the dream plane. While dreamwalking, when a creature makes a spell attack roll against you or an ally within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on that roll. Conversely, when you make a spell attack roll against a creature, you can make that roll with advantage. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: While dreamwalking, when a creature makes a spell attack roll against you or an ally within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on that roll. Conversely, when you make a spell attack roll against a creature, you can make that roll with advantage.

description.p: At 10th level, you can draw faeries directly from the dream realm. You can cast conjure woodland beings without expending a spell slot. Your concentration for this spell can’t be broken as a result of taking damage. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast conjure woodland beings without expending a spell slot. Your concentration for this spell can’t be broken as a result of taking damage.

description.p: Upon reaching 14th level in this class, Titania, the Summer Queen, bestows a gold and emerald coloration upon you, symbolizing your dedication to the Court. During a dreamwalk, after moving at least 10 feet, you can use a bonus action to turn invisible until the beginning of your next turn. Attacking or casting a spell ends the invisibility early.

sheet.description: During a dreamwalk, after moving at least 10 feet, you can turn invisible until the beginning of your next turn. Attacking or casting a spell ends the invisibility early.

description.p: The Unseelie armies always seek to bolster their numbers; those who answer the call gain the Avatar of the Dream Warrior. These fierce, etheral combatants combine their physical prowess with their mental. They can draw upon the mystical energies of the Feywild to deliver pain and confusion to their enemies. Dream warriors tend to be dextrous magic fighters, as difficult to catch as a dream.
The Unseelie lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a dreamer spell. The following spells are added to the dreamer spell list for you.
When you adopt the Aspect of the Dream Warrior at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with medium armor, shields and martial weapons.

Winter’s Aegis: Starting at 3rd level, you gain the protection of the Gloaming Court. When you roll initiative, a cloak of dark frost envelops you. The cloak is an Armor of Agathys cast at your current Dreamer spell slot level.

sheet.description: When you roll initiative, a cloak of dark frost envelops you. The cloak is an Armor of Agathys cast at level {{$(spellcasting:slots)}}.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: Upon gaining 10th level when you hit a creature with a weapon attack while dreamwalking, the target is outlined by a shimmering icy mist until the end of your next turn. The next attack roll against the creature has advantage. On a hit, the target is suspended 5 feet in the air, upside down. The creature must expend half their movement speed to escape the levitation.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack while dreamwalking, the target is outlined by a shimmering icy mist until the end of your next turn. The next attack roll against the creature has advantage. On a hit, the target is suspended 5 feet in the air, upside down. The creature must expend half their movement speed to escape the levitation.

description.p: At 14th level, your devotion to the Queen of Air and Darkness is complete. As an action, you can offer her your physical heart. Upon doing so, your body takes on a grey palor, but you are favored with the following traits:

ul.li: Your attacks deal an extra 2d6 necrotic damage.

Undead Fortitude: If damage reduces you to 0 Hit Points, you must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, you drop to 1 hit point instead.

description.p: The condition lasts until you die or your heart grows back after a long rest.

sheet.description: You offer her your physical heart to the Queen of Air. Your attacks deal an extra 2d6 necrotic damage. If damage reduces you to 0 Hit Points, you must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, you drop to 1 hit point instead.

description.p: The Shadowfell is an unforgiving plane of horrors seen and unseen. By opening yourself to its energies, you gain the Avatar of the Shadow Stalker. Dreamwalking through the Shadowfell can allow one to bypass mundane barriers and wear shadow itself as a protective cloak.

Dream Stalkers typically focus their abilities on those that feed off the fears or lifeforce of their opponents. They typically favor spells that twist the mind or draw upon the strengths of the shadows, preferring to target one’s nightmares over their dreams.
The Shadowfell lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a dreamer spell. The following spells are added to the dreamer spell list for you.
When you accept the Avatar of the Shadow Stalker at 3rd level, a fine, black mist trails off you constantly.

ul.li: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 60 feet.
You can cast mage armor on yourself without expending a spell slot.
When you cause physical or psychic damage to a creature, you can add your intelligence modifier to the damage.

sheet.description: A fine, black mist trails off you constantly. You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 60 feet. You can cast mage armor on yourself without expending a spell slot. When you cause physical or psychic damage to a creature, you add {{intelligence:modifier}} to the damage.

description.p: When you successfully hit a creature with an attack, the creature must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or be corrupted. When a corrupted creature hits with a weapon or spell attack, it must subtract half your dreamer level from the damage, to a minimum of 1 damage dealt. Additionally, when you roll damage against a corrupted creature, you can add your Intelligence modifier to the damage. A corrupted creature can use an action to repeat the Intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC to end the corruption.

sheet.description: When you successfully hit a creature with an attack, the creature must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw (save DC {{spellcasting:dc:int}}) or be corrupted. When a corrupted creature hits with a weapon or spell attack, it must subtract {{level:dreamer:half}} from the damage, to a minimum of 1. Additionally, when you roll damage against a corrupted creature, you can add {{intelligence:modifier}} to the damage. A corrupted creature can use an action to repeat the saving throw to end the corruption.

description.p: At 6th level, while you are dreamwalking, you can use a bonus action to target the mind of a creature within 30 feet of you and teleport to an unoccupied space adjacent to it. If you choose, the creature also takes 1d4 psychic damage and has disadvantage on its next saving throw.

sheet.description: While you are dreamwalking, you can target the mind of a creature within 30 feet of you and teleport to an unoccupied space adjacent to it. If you choose, the creature also takes 1d4 psychic damage and has disadvantage on its next saving throw.

description.p: When you reach 10th level, confrontations with you are like fighting a living darkness. Once per dreamwalk, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you implant the darkness of the Shadowfell into its mind. The creature effectively suffers from the blinded condition until the end of your dreamwalk. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make an Intelligence saving throw to remove the illusion. On a success, the effect ends.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you implant the darkness of the Shadowfell into its mind. The creature effectively suffers from the blinded condition until the end of your dreamwalk. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make an Intelligence saving throw (save DC {{spellcasting:dc:int}}) to remove the illusion. On a success, the effect ends.

description.p: At 14th level you have mastered the shadow magic of the dreamworld. As an action while dreamwalking, make an attack roll against a creature. If the attack hits, you rip a shadow of the creature’s spirit out of the dream world, rooting the shadow to that spot. While the creature is within 30 feet of it’s spirit shadow, its movement speed is halved and half of any damage the spirit takes (rounded up) is transferred to the creature as psychic damage. The shadow’s AC is 10 + the creature’s Intelligence modifier. The affected creature can use an action to make an Intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC to end the effect. You can’t use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: While dreamwalking, make an attack roll against a creature. If the attack hits, you rip a shadow of the creature’s spirit out of the dream world, rooting the shadow to that spot. While the creature is within 30 feet of it’s spirit shadow, its movement speed is halved and half of any damage the spirit takes (rounded up) is transferred to the creature as psychic damage. The shadow’s AC is 10 + the creature’s Intelligence modifier. The affected creature can use an action to make an Intelligence saving throw (save DC {{spellcasting:dc:int}}) to end the effect.

description.p: You point at one creature you can see within range, and create a disturbing daydream within its mind. The target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or take 1d8 psychic damage and it can’t take reactions until the start of its next turn.
At Higher Levels. The spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

You place a charm on an ally that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, they deal an extra 1d6 psychic damage when they hit with an attack. Also, choose one ability when you cast the spell. The targeted ally has advantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability.
If the targeted ally falls unconscious before this spell ends, you can use a bonus action on a subsequent turn of yours to charm a new ally.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, you can target two allies with this spell. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target up to three allies with this spell.

You project an image of a creature, object or humanoid the target trusts and feels comfortable with. The imaginary friend can only be seen by you and them. For the duration, the target has advantage against saving throws to be frightened.
While the imaginary friend exists, the target can use a reaction to end one fear effect on themself. This causes the imaginary friend to disappear and the spell ends.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional ally for each slot level above 2nd.

You summon mystical energy that assumes the form of a vehicle of your choosing. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the vehicle takes on the form of a cart, chariot, carriage, rowboat, sled or wagon. The vehicle can hold up to 6 medium creatures, including drivers, or 2500 pounds. The chariot can only hold 2 medium creatures, including 1 driver, or 750 pounds. If more weight is placed on it, the spell ends, and everything in the vehicle falls to the ground. One large creature can replace 2 medium creatures and 2 small creatures can replace 1 medium creature.

You decide if any creatures pull the vehicle, as well as the appearance of those creatures, up to a maximum of two. They are considered part of the conjured vehicle and can not be moved more than 30 feet from the vehicle itself.

The vehicle has a speed of 40 feet and can travel 4 miles an hour, or 6 miles at a fast pace. The vehicle has an AC 12 and hit points equal to 5 times your proficiency bonus. When the spell ends, the vehicle gradually fades, giving riders 1 minute to dismount. The spell ends if you use an action to dismiss it or if the vehicle drops to 0 hit points. Once lost, hit points can not be recovered by any means.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the vehicle can grow to accomodate 1 additional medium creature or 500 pounds for each slot level above 3rd.

You create a rift and fill your surroundings with a momentary glimpse of the dream-like Feywild. When you cast the spell, choose one of the three following landscapes. Creatures you choose must make an Intelligence saving throw or suffer the effect of the chosen terrain.

ul.li: Land of the Seelie - Titania, the Summer Queen, transforms your surroundings into the scene of your greatest deed. Those who fail their Intelligence saving throw are charmed by you until the end of your next turn.

Forests of the Unseelie - The Queen of Air and Darkness transforms your surroundings into the wild forests of the Feywild. Twisting vines and dense underbrush make movement nigh impossible. Those who fail their Intelligence saving throw are restrained until the end of your next turn.

Mists of the Shadowfell - Shar, Mistress of the Night, transforms your surroundings into a twisted land of mist and weaving shadows. Those who fail their Intelligence saving throw are frightened until the end of your next turn.
